name: Oleander
climate: Oleander thrives in a Mediterranean climate with hot, dry summers.
It can also grow well in subtropical regions with mild winters.
In temperate climates, oleander requires protection from harsh frost.
It is tolerant of coastal climates and can withstand salty air exposure.
sunlight: Oleander prefers full sun to maximize its blooming potential and growth.
It can tolerate partial shade, but full sun promotes healthier foliage.
Sunlight helps in drying the leaves and reduces fungal diseases.
In low light conditions, flowering might be reduced significantly.
watering: Oleander requires regular watering, especially during hot summer months.
Allow soil surface to dry slightly between watering to avoid root rot.
In areas with adequate rainfall, supplemental watering may be minimal.
During winter, reduce watering frequency as the plant's growth slows.
soil: Oleander thrives in well-draining soil to prevent waterlogging issues.
It can grow in sandy or loamy soils enriched with organic matter.
Good soil drainage is crucial as oleander does not like excessive moisture.
A mix of garden soil, sand, and compost can be ideal for pots.
toxic: Oleander is highly toxic if ingested and can cause severe symptoms.
All parts of the plant, including the sap, contain toxic compounds.
extra_care_tip: Regularly prune oleander to maintain shape and encourage bushy growth.
Wear gloves when handling the plant to avoid skin irritation.
